thread.title: RB Leipzig unconcerned over suggestions they could be barred from next season's Champions League
thread.title_full: RB Leipzig unconcerned over suggestions they could be barred from next season's Champions League

author: Alex Richards
title: RB Leipzig unconcerned over suggestions they could be barred from next season's Champions League
text:
Sport RB Leipzig unconcerned over suggestions they could be barred from next season's Champions League UEFA are waiting until the end of the season to see how things play out before committing to the issue Share There could be bad news on the horizon for RBL (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
RB Leipzig are not concerned that they will be barred from playing in the Champions League next season. 
A report in an Austrian newspaper on Wednesday suggested that UEFA could remove either RBL or Red Bull Salzburg from next season’s competition. 
The German upstarts are well placed to qualify for the 2017-18 competition after an outstanding debut season in the Bundesliga, where they have emerged as the closest challengers to champions Bayern Munich. 
In Austria, sister side Salzburg currently top the table and are favourites to retain their title, thus securing a place in the qualifying rounds of the Champions League. RB Leipzig are challenging in the Bundesliga under Ralph Hasenhuttl (Photo: AFP/Getty) Ex-Brighton and Watford boss Oscar Garcia is in charge in Salzburg (Photo: 2016 Getty Images) 
But UEFA rules state no two clubs controlled by the same sponsor, organisation or person may play simultaneously in the same European competition. 
That could put the two sides’ owners, energy drinks giants Red Bull, on a collision course with European football’s governing body. 
However Oliver Mintzlaff, CEO for RB Leipzig and also chief of Red Bull's Global Head of Soccer, is unworried. 
"We are not nervous at RB Leipzig and also the UEFA signals don't exist,” he told German publication SID. 
"If we qualify there is no reason why we should doubt to play in Europe next season.” Red Bull owner Dietrich Mateschitz (Photo: Ker Robertson) Read More Oliver Burke and RB Leipzig: A move to Germany's most hated club 
Salzburg have been competing in the Europa League this season, while RBL have yet to taste European action. 
UEFA say that any potential ban is at present merely “hypothetical” and are refusing to be drawn on the possible scenario until the end of the season. 
"We cannot comment at this stage on what is a hypothetical question,” a UEFA spokesman declared. 
"[There will be] more concrete information from the beginning of June, when the list of participating clubs taking part in UEFA European competitions is published." poll loading Who will win the Bundesliga? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
